intro: Erigeron sanglichensis, commonly known as the Korean fleabane, is a flowering plant native to East Asia, particularly Korea. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron sanglichensis is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in temperate climates.
